prompt: Elizabeth Hurley is a renowned British actress and model, born in 1965. Please write a short biography of Elizabeth Hurley.

Elizabeth Hurley is a celebrated British actress, model, and entrepreneur, born on June 10, 1965, in St. Clair, Jamaica. She grew up in a family of modest means, moving to the UK with her parents at a young age. Hurley's early life was marked by a passion for the arts, and she began her career in show business as a model, signing with Ford Models at the age of 18.

Her breakthrough came in the 1990s when she appeared in a string of successful films, including the hit comedy "Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery" alongside Mike Myers, and the critically acclaimed drama "Passport to Paris" opposite Marie Menken. Her performances earned her a loyal fan base and critical acclaim, solidifying her status as a leading lady in Hollywood.

In addition to her film work, Hurley has also made a name for herself in the fashion world, gracing the covers of top magazines such as Vogue, Harper's Bazaar, and Elle. She has walked the runway for some of the world's most prestigious designers and has been a brand ambassador for luxury beauty companies.

Outside of her creative pursuits, Hurley is a devoted mother to her son, Damian, whom she shares with her former partner, Steve Bing. She is also a passionate philanthropist, supporting various charitable causes, including the Make-A-Wish Foundation and the Elizabeth Hurley Trust, which she established to provide aid to underprivileged children.

Throughout her illustrious career, Elizabeth Hurley has been recognized with numerous awards and nominations, including a Screen Actors Guild Award and a Golden Globe nomination. Her enduring charm, wit, and beauty have captivated audiences worldwide, cementing her status as a true Hollywood icon.

Elizabeth Hurley is a British actress, model, and entrepreneur, born on June 10, 1965, in Basingstoke, Hampshire, England. She is best known for her roles in television and film, as well as her stunning looks and captivating presence on the red carpet.

Hurley's early life was marked by a passion for dance and the performing arts. She attended the Trafalgar School for Girls and later studied at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art (LAMDA). After graduating, she began her career in modeling, working for various fashion brands and appearing on the covers of numerous magazines.

In the early 1990s, Hurley transitioned to acting, making her screen debut in the 1992 film "Passion". She gained widespread recognition for her role as Vanessa Kensington in the 1997 James Bond film "Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery". Her performance earned her a Golden Globe nomination for Best Supporting Actress.

Hurley's subsequent film credits include "Bedazzled" (2000), "Serving Sara" (2002), and "Duke of Groove" (2000). She has also appeared in several television shows, including "Gossip Girl", "The Royals", and "The Wedding Year".

In addition to her acting career, Hurley is a successful entrepreneur. She has launched several businesses, including a swimwear line and a skincare company. She has also been involved in various charitable initiatives, including the Elizabeth Hurley Breast Cancer Research Fund and the Elton John AIDS Foundation.

Throughout her career, Hurley has been recognized for her stunning looks and has been named one of the "Sexiest People in the World" by People magazine. She has been married twice, first to actor Shane Warne and then to businessman Arun Nayar. She has a son, Damian, born in 2002, from a previous relationship.

With a career spanning over three decades, Elizabeth Hurley has established herself as a talented and versatile actress, model, and entrepreneur. Her captivating presence and enduring popularity have made her a beloved figure in the entertainment industry.

In the early 1990s, Hurley transitioned to acting, making her screen debut in the 1992 film "Passion". Her most notable role to date is likely that of Vanessa Kensington in the James Bond film "Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery" (1997).

Throughout her career, Hurley has appeared in numerous films and television shows, including "Bedazzled" (2000), "Serving Sara" (2002), "Gossip Girl" (2007-2012), and "The Royals" (2015-2018).

In addition to her acting and modeling endeavors, Hurley has also launched her own swimwear line, Elizabeth Hurley Beach, and has been involved in various charity work, particularly with the Elton John AIDS Foundation.

Throughout her life, Elizabeth Hurley has been recognized for her contributions to the entertainment industry, including a nomination for a Golden Globe Award and a win at the British Fashion Awards. She has also been featured on several "most beautiful" lists, including People magazine's 50 Most Beautiful People.
